conversation:
Fist Marcus: Ah. True Soul. How glad I am to see you again.
InternalNodeContext: Player revealed Marcus at the checkpoint.
Isobel: Not a step closer, Marcus. I'm warning you.
Fist Marcus: I don't know what your game is, but you can still redeem yourself if you follow my lead.

NodeContext: Anger in his voice.
Fist Marcus: My instructions are clear: take the girl to Ketheric. Alive.
Fist Marcus: True Soul. My instructions are clear: take the girl to Ketheric. Alive.
Player: Probe his thoughts for more information.
: True
Narrator: *A haunting face swims into your mind's eye, its instructions vivid in your mind: nothing is more important than bringing the girl - alive.*
Isobel: What's going on? If you have something to say, say it.
Player: Marcus is trying to kidnap you, Isobel. We're going to need to fight our way out of this one.

Fist Marcus: Ah. True Soul. How glad I am to see you again.
InternalNodeContext: Player revealed Marcus at the checkpoint.
Isobel: Not a step closer, Marcus. I'm warning you.

NodeContext: Anger in his voice.
Fist Marcus: My instructions are clear: take the girl to Ketheric. Alive.
Fist Marcus: True Soul. My instructions are clear: take the girl to Ketheric. Alive.
Player: I know. Let's do this.
Isobel: What's going on? If you have something to say, say it.
Player: Marcus is trying to kidnap you, Isobel. We're going to need to fight our way out of this one.

Isobel: CinematicNodeContext: Isobel kneeling at corpse
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Isobel gets up
Isobel: What the hells is this?
Narrator: *Your tingling Urge knows her face - this is the cleric Sceleritas sent you to kill.*
Player: He was trying to kidnap you. I sensed the tadpole in his head.
Isobel: A tadpole? Maiden's milk - how could that be?
Player: I have no reason to lie. Marcus was a danger to you all.
: True
Isobel: In that case, I owe you a debt of gratitude.
Isobel: You're the True Soul from the gate, right? It's a good thing you were here. I'm Isobel. And we have much to discuss.
Player: I may be a True Soul, but I'm not like Marcus. The parasite doesn't control me.
Isobel: If I didn't believe it before, I certainly do now.
Isobel: Speaking of blessings... you'll be needing my protection spell.
Isobel: Let me guess: Jaheira's sent you to beg a protection spell off her favourite cleric.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: |Casts 'Protection from Good and Evil', but modified with Selunite (moon) magic to protect against the Shadowcurse specifically. Isobel can use the planned animations for this spell cinematically, or something bespoke as best fits the scene. (lighting tests in progree for clouds revealing the moon)

We see every present party member  take on a moon-like effect as a result of being targeted with the spell, which then fades as though absorbed by each of them. This gives them a special in-game status to protect them from the curse|

We see every present party member  take on a moon-like effect as a result of being targeted with the spell, which then fades as though absorbed by each of them. This gives them a special in-game status to protect them from the curse|
Narrator: *The blessing falls uneasily over your tainted body. You can't help but dream: to kill her would destroy all of Last Light. You yearn for it so deeply...*
Shadowheart: Ngh... it hurts...
Isobel: Perfect.
Isobel: It'll make you immune to the lesser effects of the shadow curse, which will get you closer to the Towers.
Isobel: It won't be enough to protect you against areas of utter darkness, though - where the curse is strongest. This lantern should, though.
Player: Very nice of you, but I've been to Moonrise Towers already.
Isobel: You... have. Forgive me for gilding the lily. I suppose if Jaheira hasn't gone tearing into the night, there's work to be done there yet.
Isobel: I wish you luck. The very best of it.
Player: Hold on - Marcus is a True Soul. He's here to kidnap you.

Narrator: *You don't sleep well, flitting between dreams and nightmares.*
Narrator: *Maybe you wake up because you know something is wrong. Or maybe you just get lucky.*
Astarion: ...Shit.
NodeContext: Hunched over the player's bedroll, about to bite someone, but they've just woken up and are looking up at you. More deadpan than urgent.
Astarion: No no - it's not what it looks like, I swear!
Astarion: I wasn't going to hurt you! I just needed - well, blood.
Narrator: *There, in dim firelight, you see him for what he really is: a vampire. A slave to sanguine hunger.*
Player: You were strangely concerned when we met the monster hunter in the swamp.
Astarion: It's not what you think - I'm not some monster!
Astarion: I feed on animals! Boars, deer, kobolds - whatever I can get.
Astarion: I'm just too slow right now. Too weak.
Astarion: If I just had a little blood, I could think clearer. Fight better. Please.
Narrator: *A strange sensation courses through you, and your companion's mind unfolds, secrets half-revealed.*
Player: Why didn't you tell me?
Astarion: At best, I was sure you'd say no. More likely, you'd ram a stake through my ribs.
Astarion: No, I needed you to trust me. And you can trust me.
Player: I do. I believe you.
Astarion: Thank you. Do you think you could trust me just a little further?
Astarion: I only need a taste, I swear.
Player: All right, but go too far and I'll drive a stake through your chest.
Astarion: Ah. Of course. I shall be gentle as a babe.
Astarion: Let's make ourselves comfortable, shall we?
NodeContext: Astarion gestures, inviting the player to lie down on the bedroll at his feet.
Narrator: *It's like a shard of ice into your neck - a quick, sharp pain that fades to throbbing numbness. Your breath catches, your pulse quickens.*
Player: Push him back.
: False
Narrator: *You try to push him back, but his grip just gets tighter. You can feel your blood racing, coursing through both your bodies.*
Player: Stop! It's too much.
: True
Astarion: Ah! Of course.
Astarion: I was just swept up in the moment.
Astarion: But it worked. I feel good. Strong. Happy!
Player: You almost killed me!
Astarion: But I didn't. And that's what matters.
Astarion: And look what you've gained. Together, we can take on the world.
Player: You need to leave my camp. Now.

Viconia DeVir: Finish it. Send me to Lady Shar's embrace.
Shadowheart: She still has answers I need.
Player: Make it quick.
Shadowheart: My parents. Where are they?
Viconia DeVir: So blunt - have you forgotten all the interrogation techniques I taught you? Where is the finesse?
Shadowheart: Answer me!
Viconia DeVir: They are right through that door, in the Chamber of Loss. Where they have been all along. You saw them many times, only we made you forget. But they didn't forget.
Viconia DeVir: They watched, as we moulded you. They watched. They wept. They bled - often at your hand. It may not be a happy reunion, but it will be a memorable one.
Player: Such cruelty...
Shadowheart: Why? Why me? Why all this effort?
Viconia DeVir: Lady Shar commanded me. And I obeyed. I do not question - I merely act as she wills me to.
Viconia DeVir: I had an enclave in Waterdeep, you know. Much grander than this. Shar ordered me to raze it, kill all who followed me - claim they betrayed me, when in fact I slew those who showed nothing but loyalty.
Viconia DeVir: Shar had me do that, and I did. To cover my tracks. To usher in you.
Shadowheart: What are you talking about?
Viconia DeVir: You became my mission. To take a child of Selûne's, and turn her over to Lady Shar. To show that all light fades, and darkness will prevail in the end.
Viconia DeVir: All this was to make you into what the Dark Lady needed you to be - the planning. The training. Those deaths in Waterdeep. It was all to groom you to replace me at her right hand side. And still, you threw it away.
Player: What do you want to do, Shadowheart?
Shadowheart: I want to see my parents. And I don't care what happens to this one. She's been in my head long enough already. Do what you like. I know you'll choose well.
Viconia DeVir: What are you doing? Come back and finish this yourself! You owe me that!
Shadowheart: Let go, Mother. Embrace loss.
Jaheira: She stands at the same crossroads you yourself once did, Viconia - but it seems you are not quite the teacher you thought.
Minsc: Boo thinks you have had every chance to change your ways. Count yourself blessed it is not he who judges you today.
Player: Go. If you're wise, you'll vanish.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: [opening, face-to-face]

Wyll and Karlach stand facing one another, fists clenched.

Wyll and Karlach stand facing one another, fists clenched.
Wyll: One horn. The stink of Avernus. Advocatus diaboli.
Karlach: Well I'll be godsdamned - the Blade of Frontiers. Thought I'd shaken you for good. That'll teach me to underestimate you.
Wyll: Karlach. The archdevil Zariel's gladiator, come to burn the Sword Coast to ash.
Player: You've got it all wrong, Wyll. Karlach's not about to hurt anyone.
Karlach: Well - not counting the fuckers that need a good hurting.
Wyll: Shut it, devil - I know your kind. A heart darker than a shadow's nightmares. You'd cut a child's throat just to taste the blood.
Karlach: A devil? I didn't take the Blade for a fool. I'm - ngh!
Narrator: *A great fire roars through you - the fire of the First Hell.*
Narrator: *You are Karlach, tearing through demons across a blood-red landscape of fire and volcanic cinder.*
Narrator: *The front lines of the Blood War. With every swing of her axe, Karlach fulfils mistress Zariel's purpose.*
Wyll: Proof, clear as summer sky. It's over, Karlach. It's time you feel the sting of the Blade.
Karlach: I've tried to tell you - I'm not what you think I am.
Narrator: *Another vision. Karlach's blade raised, slicing through devils - Zariel's servants - as her eyes dart around, seeking escape.*
Narrator: *Wyll shudders with Karlach's desperation. She is a victim of the Blood War, not an agent of it.*
Wyll: By Balduran's helm, I - no. I will not be tricked!
Karlach: You saw the truth. I may be an effective soldier, but I never wanted to serve Zariel. Legged it away from her the first chance I got.
Wyll: And yet you served.
Player: Be practical. She's infected, same as us. We need allies, not enemies.
: False
Wyll: No. Devils can not be trusted!
Player: You're right. Let's cut her down before she causes any trouble.

Araj Oblodra: I'll even compensate you - a potion of legendary power that forever increases the strength of the one who consumes it.
Araj Oblodra: It's not for sale, but it's yours if you bite me.

Araj Oblodra: Excuse me? This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity and you're squandering it.
Astarion: I gave you my answer.

Astarion: Because there's something wrong with her blood. I can smell it from here - it's rank.
Player: Don't be dramatic, it's just a bite. One nip and you're done.
Astarion: Easy for you to say, you won't have to taste whatever sludge is in those veins.
Astarion: Fine, I'll do it.

Shadowheart: Answer me!
Viconia DeVir: They are right through that door, in the Chamber of Loss. Where they have been all along. You saw them many times, only we made you forget. But they didn't forget.
Viconia DeVir: They watched, as we moulded you. They watched. They wept. They bled - often at your hand. It may not be a happy reunion, but it will be a memorable one.

Shadowheart: Why? Why me? Why all this effort?
Viconia DeVir: Lady Shar commanded me. And I obeyed. I do not question - I merely act as she wills me to.
Viconia DeVir: I had an enclave in Waterdeep, you know. Much grander than this. Shar ordered me to raze it, kill all who followed me - claim they betrayed me, when in fact I slew those who showed nothing but loyalty.
Viconia DeVir: Shar had me do that, and I did. To cover my tracks. To usher in you.
Shadowheart: What are you talking about?
Viconia DeVir: You became my mission. To take a child of Selûne's, and turn her over to Lady Shar. To show that all light fades, and darkness will prevail in the end.
Viconia DeVir: All this was to make you into what the Dark Lady needed you to be - the planning. The training. Those deaths in Waterdeep. It was all to groom you to replace me at her right hand side. And still, you threw it away.
Player: What do you want to do, Shadowheart?
Shadowheart: I want to see my parents. And I don't care what happens to this one. She's been in my head long enough already. Do what you like. I know you'll choose well.
Viconia DeVir: What are you doing? Come back and finish this yourself! You owe me that!
Shadowheart: Let go, Mother. Embrace loss.
